page.title: 20PENSIONERS IN BRECHIN
page.content: We interviewed pensioners in the town to obtain their views on several topics.Although a few have moved here in retirement, often from the rural areas, most lived in Brechin when they were employed.They find the town pleasant and quiet but note that the close-knit community means that people know other people's business and this can be irritating at times.They find plenty to do e.g. coach trips to scenic areas or cities,concerts, bingo, coffee mornings and walks in the country and along the river.Some regularly visit relatives in other parts of the country.Most liked the young people they knew and felt that more facilities , such as a leisure centre, in the town would cut down the vandalism of the mindless few.Overall the vast majority seemed to enjoy their "Golden Years" in Brechin.
